elevation-01.description: use for shadow of components, such as cards, menus. Combine with surface.secondary

elevation-02.description: Use for shadow of elements that sit on top of they UI, such as modals, dialogs, dropdown menus. Combine with surface.tertiary

primary.description: Use as a background color for the site which appears behind scrollable content.

primary-eclipse.description: Use to darken scrollable content on surface elevation.

secondary.description: use for surfaces of components, such as cards, menus. Combine with elevation-01

secondary-hover.description: Use for secondary surface elements in a hovered state.

secondary-eclipse.description: Use to darken scrollable content on secondary surface.

tertiary.description: Use for surfaces of elements that sit on top of they UI, such as modals, dialogs, dropdown menus. Combine with elevation-02

tertiary-hover.description: Use for tertiary surface elements in a hovered state.

tertiary-eclipse.description: Use to darken scrollable content on tertiary surface.

primary.description: Use to visually group or separate UI elements, such as text fields, checkboxes, and radio buttons.

secondary.description: The default background for neutral elements, disabled states

tertiary.description: Use for gray backgrounds when there is no meaning tied to the color. Reserved for when you only want a hint of color.

accent.description: Use for the background of elements to reinforce our brand with more emphasis, such as button or Elements in a selected state - checkboxes, radiobuttons ets.

accent-hover.description: Use for accent background of elements in a hovered state.

accent-press.description: Use for background of elements in a pressed state.

brand.description: Use for background that reinforces our brand.

brand-hover.description: Use for brand background of elements in a pressed state.

success.description: Use for backgrounds communicating a favourable outcome, such as in success section messages.

error.description: Use for backgrounds communicating critical information, such in error section messages.

warning.description: Use for backgrounds communicating caution, such as in warning section messages.

orange.description: Use for orange backgrounds when there is no meaning tied to the color.

blue.description: Use for blue backgrounds when there is no meaning tied to the color.

white.description: A vibrant background option for colored UI elements, such as announcement banners, white buttons.

disabled.description: Use for backgrounds of elements in a disabled state.

minimal.description: Use to visually group or separate UI elements, such as table divider ets.

subtle.description: Use to visually group or separate UI elements, such as cards, outlined buttons, text fields, checkboxes, and radio buttons.

bold.description: Use for borders of elements in a hovered state.

contrast.description: Use for borders of elements in a pressed state.

accent.description: Use for borders or visual indicators of elements that reinforce our brand.

brand.description: Use for borders or visual indicators of elements in a selected or opened state, such as in tabs or menu items.

success.description: Use for borders communicating a favourable outcome, such as the borders on validated text fields.

error.description: Use for borders communicating critical information, such as the borders on invalid text fields.

warning.description: Use for borders communicating critical information, such as the borders on invalid text fields.

primary.description: Use for primary text, such as headers, navigation, input field placeholder, button outlined, active tabs.

secondary.description: Use for secondary text, such as body.

tertiary.description: Use for tertiary text, such as input field labels, inactive tabs.

disabled.description: Use for text in a disabled state.

onСolor.description: Use for text on colored backgrounds.

onСolor-disabled.description: Use for text in a disabled state on colored backgrounds.

onColor-inactive.description: Use for menu in an inactive state on colored backgrounds.

onWhite.description: Use for text on white backgrounds, such as white buttons.

accent.description: Use for text in selected or opened states, such as dropdown buttons, links.

brand.description: Use for text that reinforces our brand.

success.description: Use for text to communicate a favourable outcome, such as input field success messaging.

error.description: Use for critical text, such as input field error messaging.

warning.description: Use for text to emphasize caution.

Use for icons paired with 
text.primary

secondary.description: Use for icons paired with text.secondary

disabled.description: Use for icon in a disabled state.

on-color.description: Use for icon on colored backgrounds.

onColor-disabled.description: Use for icon in a disabled state on colored backgrounds.

onWhite.description: Use for icon on white backgrounds, such as white buttons.

accent.description: Use for icon in selected or opened states.

brand.description: Use for icon that reinforces our brand.

green.description: Use for green icons when there is no meaning tied to the color.

red.description: Use for red icons, when there is no meaning tied to the color.

yellow.description: Use for red icons when there is no meaning tied to the color.
